neatCore

Class Species

  • java.lang.Object
    • neatCore.Species

  • public class Species
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is meant to be used for organization, rather than actual data storage. I didn't want this class to have the member "List genomes", but I couldn't think of a better way to map a species to a list of genomes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Species(Genome g)
      Constructs a new species with Genome g as its representative.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Genome g)
      Adds a genome to the species.
      float getCompatibility(Genome g)
      Determines the compatibility of g and this species' representative, and returns the result.
      java.util.List<Genome> getGenomes() 
      int getID()
      Returns an integer that uniquely represents this Species object
      float getModifiedFitness(Genome g)
      Calculates the fitness of g, adjusted for species size and progress.
      float getMutationScalar(float totalPopulation) 
      void prepareForNextGeneration()
      Increments the species' age, looks for a new peak fitness (unadjusted), and sets the value of gensSincePeakFitness accordingly.
      float size()
      Returns the number of genomes that are part of this species.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Species

        public Species(Genome g)
        Constructs a new species with Genome g as its representative. Also adds g as a member.

    • Method Detail

      • prepareForNextGeneration

        public void prepareForNextGeneration()
        Increments the species' age, looks for a new peak fitness (unadjusted), and sets the value of gensSincePeakFitness accordingly. Clears the current members. Directly in line with the paper, it also selects a new representative randomly.

      • getModifiedFitness

        public float getModifiedFitness(Genome g)
        Calculates the fitness of g, adjusted for species size and progress.

      • getCompatibility

        public float getCompatibility(Genome g)
        Determines the compatibility of g and this species' representative, and returns the result.

      • size

        public float size()
        Returns the number of genomes that are part of this species. In other words, the species' population size.

      • add

        public void add(Genome g)
        Adds a genome to the species.

      • getGenomes

        public java.util.List<Genome> getGenomes()

      • getMutationScalar

        public float getMutationScalar(float totalPopulation)

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Returns an integer that uniquely represents this Species object
